author: Extremely-Bad-Idea
body:
IBM  . . .  their gigantic 'Global Business Services' division is the largest IT outsourcing, consulting, and business process provider on the planet.  But no one under age 30 seems to know that, LOL.  Approximately 350k employees

DXC Technology . . . formerly HP Enterprise and before that EDS and CSC.  Also a gigantic outsourcing and consulting firm with around 150k employees

author: theLOLbird
Tom0laSFW
body:
HP spent years and years on the memristor to enable inmemory compute; if I recall correctly, something along the lines of fusing your CPU and RAM. Never went anywhere, HP / HPE / DXC kind of a trash fire now.

Not saying no, am saying that it sounds as if there is a great deal of work left to do for this breakthrough, whatever it is, to actually make anyone any money; "2024, 2025 at the earliest". And there are loads of people who will get a piece of the action along the way; chip manufacturers (not IBM), device manufacturers (not IBM) big iron datacentre operators (no longer really IBM). 

TL;DR; nothings mooning here

author: _never_more
body: Fortinet is a really well run company and has gone crazy since ipo. They’re consistently near the top in quality of product and have grown like crazy. Didn’t work there but I’ve known people in the company for as like as they’ve been around.

author: AlwaysBlamesCanada
body:
Cyber security companies going to jizz in their pants at open - FEYE, FTNT, ZS, CRWD.

You’re welcome

author: munchsquadjr
body: FTNT

author: brownhotdogwater
body: Fortinet, Paloalto, crowdstrike, cloudflare

author: Cache_Flow
body: FTNT

author: fino_nyc
body: Fortinet is the best cyber security play

author: brownhotdogwater
body: Fortinet

author: stillyoinkgasp
body: Cisco, Fortinet, Palo Alto, Crowdstrike, Cambium Networks, OKTA

author: ChillMeerkat
body: I was only interested in FTNT but since it ran up 100% in a year I decided to wait for a dip. Weird nobody mentioned it here, once I read somewhere they have the best product currently. However I bought the dip on solarwinds at $16. They beat their earning estimates and they have one of the best pe if not the best in the industry. The hack may deter some customers but I think in the long run its a good buy as well.

author: BossRida
body: FTNT was fairly priced at 115$ when I bought. At 206$ I would say its way overpriced, there is no way to justify buying now. Great company tho.

author: slickshoes_
body: No one like Fortinet? It's the only one in the space that's currently making a decent profit.

author: calichejoe
body: I like fortinet defined went under the radar for most. If your interested in crypto I Gould look at FPAC if your looking into spacs like CCIV. Thomas Farley is the CEO or director and has crypto specifically mentioned in the S-1 filings. And at this price 9.70 a share you’ll could redeem but I’m planning on buying FPAC warrants shares won’t move much on an announcement but warrants will at least like 40%

author: pumpthatjazz
body: Fortinet was founded in the year 2000

author: Pnotebluechip
body: Back in 1991 I bought a Motorola bag phone, then became a bag holder of the stock. It took 20 years for everyone to "need" a cell phone. Change takes way longer than you think.

author: JohnnyBoyJr
body:
I think most Americans assume that a Motorola is going to be an American phone, and also because it has software made by Google. Nope.  
I just don't understand why the American gov't is so vehemently opposed to Huawei, but ZTE and Lenovo are perfectly OK, especially considering that ZTE is partially owned by the CCP.
